tools.name: UpdateTrelloCardSticker
tools.description:
Update a sticker on a specified Trello card.

Use this tool to update the properties of an existing sticker on a Trello card. Ideal for modifying sticker details based on card ID and sticker ID.

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Trello card to update the sticker on.

parameters.name: sticker_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the sticker to be updated on the Trello card. It must match an existing sticker on the specified card.

parameters.name: sticker_left_position
parameters.description: The left position of the sticker, ranging from -60 to 100.

parameters.name: sticker_top_position
parameters.description: The vertical position of the sticker on the card, ranging from -60 to 100. Determines the position from the top.

parameters.name: sticker_z_index
parameters.description: The z-index of the sticker, determining its layer position with respect to other stickers on the card. Provide as an integer.

parameters.name: sticker_rotation
parameters.description: The rotation angle of the sticker. Provide a number representing the degrees of rotation.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloChecklist
tools.description:
Update an existing checklist on Trello.

Use this tool to update an existing checklist in Trello. Typically called when checklist modifications are needed, such as changing item details or statuses.

parameters.name: checklist_id
parameters.description: ID of the checklist to update on Trello. This is required to specify which checklist needs updating.

parameters.name: checklist_name
parameters.description: Name of the checklist to update. Must be 1 to 16,384 characters long.

parameters.name: checklist_position
parameters.description: Specify the position of the checklist on the card. Options are `top`, `bottom`, or a positive number indicating the precise position.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloChecklistItem
tools.description:
Update an item in a Trello card checklist.

Use this tool to update a specific item in a checklist on a Trello card. It should be called when you need to modify details of an existing checklist item.

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Trello card where the checklist item is located.

parameters.name: checklist_id
parameters.description: The ID of the checklist item you want to update on the Trello card.

parameters.name: checklist_item_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the checklist item that needs to be updated on the Trello card.

parameters.name: position_in_checklist
parameters.description: Position the checklist item at the 'top', 'bottom', or a specific order with a positive float.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloComment
tools.description:
Edit a comment action in Trello.

Use this tool to update the content of a specific comment action on Trello. It is applicable only to comment actions.

parameters.name: action_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the specific action comment you want to update.

parameters.name: new_comment_text
parameters.description: The updated text content for the Trello comment action.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloLabel
tools.description:
Update Trello label details using its ID.

Use this tool to update the details of a specific Trello label by providing its ID.

parameters.name: label_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Trello label to update.

parameters.name: label_color
parameters.description: Specify the new color for the label. Allowed colors: yellow, purple, blue, red, green, orange, black, sky, pink, lime.

parameters.name: new_label_name
parameters.description: The new name for the Trello label to be updated.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloLabelField
tools.description:
Update a specific field on a Trello label.

This tool updates a specified field of a label in Trello, such as color or name. It should be used when changes to label attributes are required.

parameters.name: label_field_to_update
parameters.description: Specify the label field to update, such as 'color' or 'name'.

parameters.name: label_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Trello label to update.

parameters.name: new_field_value
parameters.description: The new value to update the specified label field with, such as a new color or name.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloList
tools.description:
Update the properties of a Trello list.

This tool updates the properties of a specified list in Trello. It should be called when there is a need to modify attributes of an existing Trello list.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Trello list to be updated.

parameters.name: archive_list
parameters.description: Set to true to archive the list, false to keep it open.

parameters.name: board_id_destination
parameters.description: ID of the board to which the list will be moved.

parameters.name: is_subscribed
parameters.description: Whether the active member is subscribed to this list. Use `true` to subscribe and `false` to unsubscribe.

parameters.name: new_list_name
parameters.description: The new name to assign to the Trello list.

parameters.name: new_list_position
parameters.description: New position for the list: 'top', 'bottom', or a positive floating point number.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloMember
tools.description:
Update Trello member details.

This tool updates a member's information in Trello. It should be called when there is a need to modify a member's details, such as changing their username or bio.

parameters.name: member_id_or_username
parameters.description: The ID or username of the Trello member to be updated.

parameters.name: avatar_source
parameters.description: Source of the avatar; must be one of: 'gravatar', 'none', or 'upload'.

parameters.name: enable_color_blind_mode
parameters.description: Set to true to enable color blind mode preferences for the member, false to disable.

parameters.name: member_bio
parameters.description: Biography of the member. Provide a brief description or update to the member's bio as a string.

parameters.name: member_initials
parameters.description: New initials for the member. Must be 1-4 characters long.

parameters.name: new_full_name
parameters.description: The new name for the member. Ensure it does not begin or end with a space.

parameters.name: new_username
parameters.description: The new username for the Trello member. It must be at least 3 characters long and can only contain lowercase letters, underscores, and numbers. The username must be unique within Trello.

parameters.name: preferred_locale
parameters.description: Specifies the preferred locale for the member's settings. This should be a valid locale string (e.g., 'en_US').

parameters.name: summary_notification_interval
parameters.description: Time interval in minutes for summary notifications. Use `-1` to disable, `1` for every minute, or `60` for hourly notifications.

member_bio.value: A passionate developer and Trello enthusiast.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloMemberNotificationSettings
tools.description:
Update blocked notification keys for a Trello member's channel.

    Use this tool to update blocked notification keys for a specific channel of a Trello member. This is useful when a user wants to change which notifications are blocked for a particular communication channel.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: member_id_or_username
parameters.description: The ID or username of the Trello member whose notification settings will be updated.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: notification_channel
parameters.description: Specify the channel where notifications should be blocked, e.g., 'email'.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateTrelloPlugin
tools.description:
Update a specific plugin on Trello.

Use this tool to update the details of a specific plugin on Trello by providing the plugin's ID.

parameters.name: organization_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or name of the organization associated with the plugin to update.

tools.name: UpdateTrelloWebhook
tools.description:
Update a Trello webhook using a specific token.

This tool updates a webhook in Trello identified by a specific token and webhook ID. Useful for modifying webhook settings or endpoints.

parameters.name: authentication_token
parameters.description: The token used for authenticating the request to update the webhook in Trello. Required for authorization.

parameters.name: webhook_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Trello webhook to be updated. Used to identify which webhook to modify.

parameters.name: callback_url
parameters.description: The URL where the webhook will POST data. Ensure the URL is accessible and correct.

parameters.name: object_id_for_webhook
parameters.description: ID of the Trello object (e.g., board, card) associated with the webhook.

parameters.name: webhook_description
parameters.description: A description to be displayed when retrieving information about the webhook.

tools.name: UpdateWorkspaceMemberStatus
tools.description:
Deactivate or reactivate a member of a workspace.

This tool allows you to deactivate or reactivate a member within a given workspace on Trello. It should be called when there's a need to change a member's active status within an organization.

parameters.name: deactivate_member
parameters.description: Set to true to deactivate the member or false to reactivate the member in the workspace.

parameters.name: member_id_or_username
parameters.description: The ID or username of the member whose status needs to be updated in the workspace.

parameters.name: organization_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the organization within Trello to update the member status.

tools.name: UploadCustomBoardBackground
tools.description:
Upload a new custom board background to Trello.

Use this tool to upload a new custom board background for a specific Trello member. Call this tool when you want to personalize a Trello board's appearance by adding a unique background.

parameters.name: background_file_upload
parameters.description: The file path or URL of the custom board background to upload. It should specify the location of the image file you want to use as the board background.

parameters.name: member_id_or_username
parameters.description: The ID or username of the Trello member for whom the background is being uploaded.

tools.name: UploadCustomStickerToTrello
tools.description:
Upload a new custom sticker to a Trello member's account.

This tool is used to upload a custom sticker for a specific Trello member. It should be called when a user wants to add a new personal sticker to their Trello account.

parameters.name: custom_sticker_file_path
parameters.description: The file path or URL of the custom sticker to be uploaded for the Trello member.

parameters.name: member_id_or_username
parameters.description: The ID or username of the Trello member to whom the custom sticker will be uploaded.

tools.name: UploadTrelloBoardBackground
tools.description:
Upload a new board background on Trello.

This tool uploads a new background image to a Trello board for a specific member. It should be called when a user wants to change or set a new background for their Trello board.

parameters.name: background_image_file_path
parameters.description: The file path for the image to be uploaded as a new board background. Provide the full path or a URL to the image file.

parameters.name: member_id_or_username
parameters.description: The ID or username of the Trello member to upload the board background for.

tools.name: VoteOnTrelloCard
tools.description:
Vote on a Trello card for a specific member.

This tool allows voting on a specific Trello card for a given member. It should be called when a user needs to add or confirm a vote on a Trello card on behalf of a member.

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Trello card on which to vote.

parameters.name: member_id_for_vote
parameters.description: The ID of the member casting a 'yes' vote on the Trello card.

documentationChunks.content:
The Arcade Trello API MCP Server requires two environment variables to authenticate with the Trello API:

- `TRELLO_API_KEY`
- `TRELLO_API_TOKEN`

**How to obtain your credentials:**

1. Log in to your [Trello account](https://trello.com/)
2. Navigate to the [Power-Ups Admin Portal](https://trello.com/power-ups/admin)
3. Click on "New" to create a new Power-Up or select an existing one
4. In your Power-Up settings, go to the **API Key** tab
5. Your **API Key** will be displayed
6. Click on the "Token" link to generate a **Token** (this will require authorization)
7. Authorize the token with the required scopes
8. Copy both the API Key and Token for use in your configuration

<Callout type="warning">
Keep `TRELLO_API_KEY` and `TRELLO_API_TOKEN` secret. Do not commit these values to source control. Use a secure secret manager or environment configuration for provisioning production credentials, and grant the token only the minimum scopes required for your integration.
</Callout>

<Callout type="info">
You can directly access your API key at: [Trello App Key](https://trello.com/app-key)
</Callout>

For more details, see the [Trello API Authentication documentation](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/trello/guides/rest-api/authorization/).

summary:
TrelloApi enables LLMs to interact with the Trello API, facilitating seamless task management and collaboration through automated actions. This toolkit provides a comprehensive set of tools for managing boards, cards, lists, and members within the Trello ecosystem.

**Capabilities:**
- Create, update, and delete Trello boards, cards, and lists.
- Manage member assignments and roles across boards and workspaces.
- Handle attachments, comments, and labels efficiently on Trello cards.
- Set up webhooks for real-time notifications on board changes.
- Utilize checklists and custom fields to enhance task organization.

**Secrets:**
- Uses TRELLO_API_KEY and TRELLO_TOKEN for secure access, managing API interactions effectively to protect data.
